history.proof: srun best use: lb_ortho_ind, in_lb_ortho_0, lb_ortho_anti_left, lb_ortho_sym, lb_ortho_sind inv: bool.

exceptions.tactic: intros a b x y Hab Hxy Hby.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: lb
x: lb
b: lb
a: lb

Goal:
a ⪯ b -> x ⪯ y -> b ⟂ y -> a ⟂ x

Premises:
lb_ortho_anti_left : forall a b x : lb, a ⪯ b -> b ⟂ x -> a ⟂ x
lb_ortho_sym : forall a b : lb, a ⟂ b -> b ⟂ a
lb_mask_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ++ a ⪯ m ++ b
lb_mask_equiv_app : forall l m a b : lb, length l = length m -> l ≂ m -> a ≂ b -> l ++ a ≂ m ++ b
andb_prop : forall a b : bool, a && b = ⟙ -> a = ⟙ /\ b = ⟙
ZMicromega.in_bdepth : forall (l : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) (a b : ZMicromega.ZWitness) (y : ZMicromega.ZArithProof), In y l -> Wf_nat.ltof ZMicromega.ZArithProof ZMicromega.bdepth y (ZMicromega.EnumProof a b l)
Inductive lb_ortho : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_ortho_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⟂ l | in_lb_ortho_1 : forall l : lb, l ⟂ nil | in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m Arguments lb_ortho (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_1 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_2 [x y]%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
lb_ortho_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_cons_inv : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⟂ y :: m -> (x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘) /\ l ⟂ m
lb_mask_le_iff : forall x y : lb, x ≂ y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> x ⪯ x0 < -> y ⪯ y0
lb_mask_leb : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
well_founded_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall P : A -> Prop, (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments Ring_theory.div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive = lb_mask_equiv_trans : Transitive lb_mask_equiv Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive : forall [x y z : lb], x ≂ y -> y ≂ z -> x ⪯ z /\ z ⪯ x Arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Transitive [x y z]
lb_mask_inv_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⪯ y :: m -> x ⪦ y /\ l ⪯ m
lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric = lb_mask_equiv_sym : Symmetric lb_mask_equiv Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> y ⪯ x /\ x ⪯ y Arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric [x y]
lb_mask_equiv_cons_Proper = fun (x y : bool) (H : x = y) => eq_ind_r (fun x0 : bool => Morphisms.respectful lb_mask_equiv lb_mask_equiv (cons x0) (cons y)) (fun (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun y1 : bool => if y1 as b return (forall x1 y2 : lb, x1 ≂ y2 -> b :: x1 ≂ b :: y2) then fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H2) (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H3) end else fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟘ ⟘ I H2) (lb_mask_leb �...
Ring.BoolTheory = {| Ring_theory.Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then ⟙ else ⟘) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟙ b = xorb b ⟙) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟘ b = xorb b ⟘) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb ⟙ (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb ⟙ b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b...

```coq
intros a b x y Hab Hxy Hby.
apply lb_ortho_anti_left with (x:=b) (x:=y).
- exact Hab.
- exact Hby.
Qed.

original: intros a b x y Hab Hxy Hby. apply lb_ortho_anti_left with (x:=b) (x:=y). - apply Hab. - apply Hby.
